oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bill Ivey CMF Interview by John Lomax III.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Bill Ivey. The interview takes place on 1-27-82.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Ivey
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:24) -- John Lomax asks Bill Ivey how many members are currently apart of NARAS (National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences). (2:16) -- John Lomax asks Bill Ivey about the several chapters of NARAS. Bill Ivey mentions Los Angeles, New York, and Nashville. (3:14) -- Bill Ivey mentions that NARAS currently consists of 61 different categories. (4:00) -- Bill Ivey discusses the difficulties of assigning certain songs to categories. (5:21) -- John Lomax asks about Bill Ivey's contracts with networks such as CBS. (9:12) -- Bill Ivey discusses the Awards Evaluation Committee for The Grammy's. (10:06) -- John Lomax asks about the creation of the 'Rock' category at The Grammy's. Bill Ivey elaborates on the previous rock/folk/pop category used by The Grammy's. (11:20) -- John Lomax asks Bill Ivey about why certain major country artists have not yet received a Grammy (in 1982) such as Merle Haggard, Eddy Arnold, Don Williams, and Hank Williams. (12:38) -- Bill Ivey mentions the crossover material popularized by certain country artists. (13:00) -- John Lomax asks why Roger Miller has won 11 awards, yet earlier mentioned artists have not. (14:32) -- John Lomax asks Bill Ivey to elaborate on the qualifications to join NARAS. (15:52) -- John Lomax asks Bill Ivey about when NARAS was founded and the date of NARAS' first award show. (16:50) -- Bill Ivey speaks about the structure of NARAS and its chapters. (19:24) -- John Lomax asks Bill Ivey about the funding of local chapters. (20:31) -- Bill Ivey elaborates on NARAS' membership rights and representation. (22:11) -- John Lomax asks Bill Ivey whether The Grammy's accurately represent the musical taste of The United States. (23:51) -- Bill Ivey speaks on the criticism of The Grammy's. (26:05) -- John Lomax asks Bill Ivey about a possible award show disaster. (27:50) -- Bill Ivey speaks on the work that goes into making The Grammy's run smoothly. (30:15) -- John Lomax asks Bill Ivey about possible bias against non-American performers. (31:24) -- John Lomax asks about a small record company's chance of winning a larger category.
